name: AutoDeafen-Linux
description: Forked to make it work on Linux. A mod that automatically hits a configurable deafen keybind when you reach a certain percentage. Configurable per-level. Original credits go to Lynxdeer

Enabled by Default.description: Whether AutoDeafen is <co>enabled by default</c> when you load into a level for the first time. Basically enables AutoDeafen globally rather than per-level.

Default Percentage.description: The <co>default percentage to deafen at</c> when you load into a level for the first time.

Enabled in Practice Mode.description: Whether AutoDeafen should be enabled during practice mode. Dunno why you'd ever want this, but it's there if you do.

Additional Debugging.description: Whether you want additional logging (for debugging) when exiting a level. Unless you're a developer, you probably want this off, since it can cause performance issues when you exit a level.
